message: Guys, I would really like to be able to look at the source code of some intermediate (in size and how difficult the code is to understand) projects. Where do you think I could find such open source stuff to look at? It's for study purposes basically, because I feel there's a gap in my knowledge that can only be filled with real world source code to look at but all I found in that regard is very complex applications. So any help would be appreciated.

data.message: Web stuff, I know php and Python as server side languages and all the other front-end stuff. And I know c# for desktop applications but I don't reckon there are many open source .net stuff, is there?

there are many open source .net stuff :D : 
 - codeplex.com 
 - browse github c# projects

there's a very very interesting python project in my humble opinion 
http://www.gittip.com/

here is the source : 
https://github.com/gittip/www.gittip.com

Ruby:
- https://github.com/clearhaus/clearhaus-ruby (disclaimer: I wrote that)
- https://github.com/saturnine/redis_analytics (rails)
- https://github.com/ace-subido/pouchnote (rails)
- https://github.com/swanson/stringer (sinatra)

Nodejs:
- https://github.com/arunoda/open-comment-box

Python:
- https://github.com/psobot/foreverfm

Just off the top of my head, I'll dig out some more of my favourites later. It's also a good habit to check Github explore.

Good luck
Thanks a lot guys. Will have a look at those. Much appreciated.
